page.title: 12Where people worship.
page.content: There is only one open church or chapel within our area, although just outside there are several places where residents go to worship. Hordley's church has a Norman nave and chancel with an interior'improved' by the Victorians. Some 20 people worship here and services are taken by the vicar of Baschurch. The church at Frankton is just outside our area but a number of Frankton's congregation are from our area. A number of people in Tetchill are active members of Ellesmere's church. These include bellringers and members of the choir. There used to be a chapel in Lower Frankton but as the population has declined this has now closed and is about to be converted into a dwelling. Present day chapel goers go to Lee Bridges,Frankton or Ellesmere. Catholics go to Ellesmere Convent.
